page.title: 19Biography (2)
page.content: The{Riding Stables}are run by the daughter of the{dairy farmer.}The main customers for the stables are from nearby villages and range from young children to adults. The majority of customers are{female.}Each day has a regular schedule although it varies from summer to winter. The horses have to be{fed, exercised}and{brushed}in the morning and then the{lessons}take place in the afternoon. The riding school has been going for three years with only a few horses, however its popularity has meant that the stables now number 31 horses. The outdoor {all-weather ring}is used for lessons, and local{bridalpaths}too. The stables have both{horses}and{ponies.}There is a lot of{competition}for stables in this area.
